comments.body: I'm not fully convinced this is a good idea. Now, you can't pipe your paragraphs through things like `fmt -80` anymore. But maybe we should not have line breaks in paragraphs (or at least sentences) anyway.

It's a tradeoff between our convenience when writing docs, implementing a check, and having error-free docs. This is the middle ground imo. If you want to invest more, one could run a check on entire files validating that single, double, and triple backticks come in matching pairs. That's clearly more implementation effort. Or we can do without a check altogether, but given how many issues this uncovered, I'm in favour of having it.
